intro: Pycnarrhena batanensis, commonly known as the Batanese pycnarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
